actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on May 17, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Bowman moved that the House do now adjourn.

actions-list.header: The Speaker laid before the House a message from the President transmitting a notification stating the national emergency with respect to the stabilization of Iraq declared in Executive Order 13303 of May 22, 2003
actions-list.actionItem: referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs and ordered to be printed (H. Doc. 118-42). May 22, 2023
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

actions-list.header: NOTIFICATION OF INTENT TO OFFER RESOLUTION
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Robert Garcia (CA) notified the House of his intent to offer a privileged resolution pursuant to clause 2(a)(1) of rule IX. The Chair announced that a determination will be made at the time designated for consideration of the resolution.
The House observed a moment of silence in honor of the victims of the recent shooting in Farmington, New Mexico.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 222
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 220

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H. Res. 398 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2494) to make the assault of a law enforcement officer a deportable offense, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3091) to allow Federal law enforcement officers to purchase retired service weapons, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 40) expressing support for local law enforcement officers and condemning efforts to defund or dismantle local law enforcement agencies."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was on the question on ordering the previous question and agreeing to H. Res. 398, if ordered, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.

The Chair announced that the objections of the President to H.J. Res. 39 would be spread at large upon the Journal and the veto message would be printed as a House document (118-41). Further consideration of the veto message and the resolution, H.J. Res. 39, is postponed until the legislative day of May 24, 2023. Agreed to without objection.
The Chair laid before the House the veto message from the President.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 16.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on H. Res. 398, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays, and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 398.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 398 — "Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2494) to make the assault of a law enforcement officer a deportable offense, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3091) to allow Federal law enforcement officers to purchase retired service weapons, and for other purposes; and providing for consideration of the concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 40) expressing support for local law enforcement officers and condemning efforts to defund or dismantle local law enforcement agencies."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Fulcher to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 16.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
